perturbation.original_text: This Content License Agreement (the “Agreement”) is made as of May 29, 2008 (the “Effective Date”), by and between Midwest Energy Emissions Corp., a Nevada corporation (“MEEC”), and Weston Solutions, Inc., a Delaware corporation (“Weston”).
perturbation.changed_text: This Content License Agreement (the “Agreement”) is made as of May 29, 2008 (the “Effective Date”), by and between Midwest Energy Emissions Corp., a Nevada corporation (“MEEC”), and Weston Solutions, Inc., a Delaware corporation (“Weston”) as of June 30, 2008.
perturbation.explanation: The Effective Date is inconsistently defined. In the original text, it's May 29, 2008. In the changed text, it's June 30, 2008. This can lead to disputes about when the agreement became legally binding and when obligations began.

perturbation.original_text: 2.  License Grant. MEEC grants to Weston a non-exclusive, royalty-free, worldwide license to use the Content for Weston’s internal business purposes.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.  License Grant. MEEC grants to Weston a non-exclusive, royalty-bearing, worldwide license to use the Content for Weston’s internal business purposes.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants a 'royalty-free' license, meaning Weston does not have to pay MEEC for using the content. The changed text grants a 'royalty-bearing' license, implying that Weston *does* have to pay MEEC. This is a direct contradiction regarding payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 7. Term and Termination. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a term of five (5) years, unless earlier terminated as provided herein.
perturbation.changed_text: 7. Term and Termination. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a term of one (1) year, unless earlier terminated as provided herein.
perturbation.explanation: The term of the agreement is directly contradicted. The original text states a five-year term, while the modified text specifies a one-year term. This creates uncertainty about the duration of the licensed rights and obligations.
